| HistoryText             = In 1942, the [[Johann Shmidt (Earth-616)|Red Skull]] had kidnapped and brainwashed the [[Invaders (WWII) (Earth-616)|Invaders]], with only [[James Buchanan Barnes (Earth-616)|Bucky]] evading capture.{{r|Invaders #5}} Bucky, realizing the danger that a [[National Socialist German Workers Party (Earth-616)|German-friendly]] Invaders posed, sent out a call for help to all the other available superheroes. Several of them came forward to help him: the [[Jeffrey Mace (Earth-616)|Patriot]], the [[Robert Frank (Earth-616)|Whizzer]], [[Madeline Joyce (Earth-616)|Miss America]], the [[Red Raven (Earth-616)|Red Raven]], the [[Bruce Dickson (Earth-616)|Thin Man]], the [[Elton Morrow (Earth-616)|Blue Diamond]], and [[Jack Frost (Earth-616)|Jack Frost]].{{r|Marvel Premiere #29}}

[[File:Liberty Legion (WWII) (Earth-616) from Invaders Vol 1 6 0002.jpg|left|thumb]]
This group called themselves the Liberty Legion and successfully freed the Invaders from the Red Skull's grasp.{{r|Invaders #6}} After the Skull's defeat, the Liberty Legion decided to remain together and act as the homefront equivalent of the Invaders.{{r|Marvel Premiere #30}}

They continued to fight various threats in the [[United States of America|U.S.]] during [[World War II|the War]], from crime to German sympathizers, and even encountered a time-traveling [[Benjamin Grimm (Earth-616)|Thing]] at one point.{{r|Marvel Two-In-One Annual #1}}{{r|Marvel Two-In-One #20}} The Invaders and the Legion joined forces again to fight the [[Helmut Gruler (Earth-616)|Iron Cross]], after which the Whizzer and Miss America left the Legion to join the Invaders.{{r|Invaders #35}}

After World War II ended, the Legion and the Invaders disbanded, with some of the members of each group coming together to form the [[All-Winners Squad (Earth-616)|All-Winners Squad]].{{r|What If? #4}}

| Notes                   = * Even though the team consisted of heroes from Marvel's 1940s [[Glossary:Golden Age of Comic Books|Golden Age]] predecessor, [[Timely Comics]], the team was assembled and named by writer [[Roy Thomas|Roy Thomas]] in 1976.

[[File:Marvel Premiere Vol 1 29.jpg|right|thumb|The Liberty Legion]]

* The Thin Man went on to co-star in the 2004–05 series ''[[New Invaders Vol 1|New Invaders]]''.

[[File:Marvel Two-In-One Vol 1 20.jpg|thumb]]

| Trivia                  = 
* The Whizzer recalls how he and Namor fought side-by-side in the Liberty Legion in {{cl|[[Avengers Vol 1 156|''Avengers'' #156 page 6 panel 6]]}}
